Basic details: Edward Green, a 65-year-old male, presents to the clinic with a new onset of hoarseness of voice.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 72/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit upright and speak with a noticeably hoarse voice.
Occasionally clear your throat.
If asked about swallowing, mention slight difficulty with large or dry foods.
If laryngoscopy is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What is a laryngoscopy?”
Challenging question: “Could this be something serious like cancer?”
